pageContext.description: Made a of circular section, ornamented with a series of regularly arranged punched dots.
pageContext.associations: found with a plain gold ring weighing 340.2 gms. (Both were purchased as above). The present habitat of the larger ring is unknown. The smaller one was obtained by Dean H.R. Dawson & passed with his Collection to the Academy.
pageContext.publications: Petrie, Dublin Penny Journal I, p. 413.
pageContext.collection: National Museum of Science & Art, Dublin, Plate XVIII, 392, W 191., purchased by Mr. Charles Stewart, silversmith, of Dame Street, Dublin.
pageContext.site: Ireland, Co Meath, near Trimleston Castle, 1833
pageContext.museumCollection: National Museum of Science & Art, Dublin
pageContext.museumID: Plate XVIII, 392, W 191., purchased by Mr. Charles Stewart, silversmith, of Dame Street, Dublin.
